summary: Plataforma para masterização de músicas com qualidade/sons profissionais, incluindo melhorias na cadeia de processamento (plugins) e um modo de referência com comparação a uma faixa masterizada.
architectural_notes: Adicionar camada de internacionalização (i18n) com seletor de idioma PT/EN e cobertura de todas as strings da UI (incluindo help/FAQ, descrições de presets e modo referência).
Adicionar suporte a PWA (manifest + service worker) para instalação e funcionamento offline, incluindo estratégia de cache para assets e páginas essenciais.
O botão de instalar PWA deve ser exibido apenas quando o app ainda não estiver instalado; após a instalação, ocultar o botão (ou trocar por estado “Instalado”).
known_issues: Build/publicação do app está falhando com erro interno de configuração, impedindo gerar versão estável e link de instalação.

existing_features.title: Create a frontend flow that lets a user upload an audio file (WAV/MP3), validates file type/size, extracts basic metadata (duration, sample rate if available), and shows a track details panel.

Implement in-browser mastering using a small set of professional-style presets (e.g., Clean, Warm, Loud, Bass Boost) using Web Audio processing (EQ, compression, limiter) and provide real-time preview playback (A/B: Original vs Mastered).
Provide export/download of the mastered result as a WAV file rendered on the client, with a progress indicator and a clear download button when rendering completes.

Add a backend data model and API to store a list of mastering projects (track name, created time, chosen preset, status) and allow the frontend to create/read/delete projects. Storing the audio bytes themselves is optional; if not stored, clearly label projects as metadata-only.

Add a coherent, creative visual theme for a music mastering product and apply it consistently across the UI (layout, typography, colors, and component styling). Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
Add a simple landing/dashboard screen that explains the workflow in English (Upload → Choose preset → Preview → Export) and links to the mastering screen.
Add basic help text and safeguards for audio mastering expectations (e.g., presets are approximations, output depends on source) and surface processing limitations clearly in English.
Render generated static images from frontend/public/assets/generated in the UI (logo + hero/illustration) as part of the theme.

Expand the in-browser mastering chain to include additional “plugin-style” processors beyond the current 3-band EQ + compressor + limiter + output gain, and make the new processors usable from presets.
Improve mastering preset quality by refining existing presets and adding new presets that leverage the expanded processing chain, with clear English names and descriptions.
Add a “Reference Mode” that lets the user load a second audio file (WAV/MP3) as a reference track and quickly compare it against the user’s mastered output for inspiration.
Implement basic loudness matching for Reference Mode to reduce the “louder sounds better” bias during A/B comparison, with a simple user control to enable/disable matching.
Update the Help/FAQ content to include an English explanation of Reference Mode and loudness matching, including limitations (e.g., loudness matching is approximate).
Add an app-wide internationalization (i18n) system with Portuguese (pt-BR) as the default language and an option to switch to English (en) at runtime.
Add a visible language switch control in the app header that allows toggling between Portuguese and English.

Translate all user-facing UI strings across the app to support both Portuguese (pt-BR) and English (en), including: Landing page, Mastering Studio page (all labels/help text), Help/FAQ content, authentication UI, profile setup modal, project list panel, toast/error messages, and any empty/error states.
Ensure preset display strings (preset name and description) are localized for both Portuguese and English, while keeping existing preset keys/behavior unchanged.
Add Progressive Web App (PWA) support so the web app can be installed from the browser and can load offline (app shell + static assets) after the first successful visit.
Add a visible install/“download” entry point in the UI that enables users to install the PWA (or shows clear manual install instructions when the install prompt is not available).
Add a credit line in the top header that states: "Created by FERSTAR JR".
Reproduce the current deployment/build failure and fix the underlying configuration/code issue so the app can build and deploy successfully, producing a stable version and installation link.
Update the existing PWA install/download entry point so it automatically hides once the app is installed (and stays hidden on subsequent visits when already installed).

Add/extend i18n strings for the install/download entry point (label + any short helper text it uses) so the new/updated UI text is localized for both Portuguese (pt-BR) and English (en). Use English copy for the en locale (e.g., "Install app").

new_feature_requests.summary: Criar uma plataforma para masterizar músicas com qualidade profissional.
Adicionar mais plugins/processadores e melhorar a qualidade da masterização (cadeia de EQ/comp/limiter e presets mais refinados).
Adicionar modo referência: carregar uma música já masterizada para servir de inspiração e permitir comparação com a faixa do usuário.
Adicionar suporte a idiomas (i18n): Português como padrão com opção de alternar para Inglês em todo o app (UI, ajuda/FAQ, presets e modo referência).
Habilitar modo PWA (instalável) com suporte offline e disponibilizar um link público para instalar/“baixar” o app via navegador.
Adicionar no topo (header) a informação/creditos: "O aplicativo foi criado por FERSTAR JR".
Adicionar um botão de “baixar/instalar o app (PWA)” na UI que desaparece após o app ser instalado.

projectName: Music mastering platform (upload, preset mastering, preview, export)
